website_summaries.verdict: The Philips SoundShooter Wireless has a sharp design and is one of the better-sounding sub-$50 tiny Bluetooth speakers -- and it has speakerphone capabilities to boot.
pros: The grenade-size Philips SoundShooter Wireless has an eye-catching design, streams music wirelessly over Bluetooth, and delivers much bigger sound than its size would indicate
It features speakerphone capabilities and its built-in rechargeable gives you about 8 hours of sound
cons: No volume control on the speaker
It also distorts at higher volumes and can't handle big bass that well

customer_reviews.title: Good product to buy any time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in 2017 and even after 3 years it is working fine. Works great, sounds bass, and powers for like 6 or 7 hours. Worth sound quality for this price. Volume compare to other Bluetooth speakers is less but sufficient for the single room,laptop or cell phone speakers, this product is great for that. Only issue is volume control buttons are missing on the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh Bhavsar

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker, But Doesn't Work for Long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this speaker in June and I have enjoyed it. However, the Bluetooth on the speaker now shuts off after about 15 seconds of it being turned on. The power remains on, as I can see the white light, but the blue light indicating the Bluetooth shuts off. I have tried what I can, but nothing seems to work. It is a good speaker and up till now it would have been a 5 star review, but don't expect it to work well for long.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Orange Speaker
customer_reviews.text: War-zone design, Bright colors, good battery life. I usually use it with my smartphone while streaming online and I noticed that quality of the audio file (Music, Video...etc.) affects the output so if you didn't like what you hear then it is possible not SoundShooter fault. I connected it to laptop working on Windows 8, Windows Phone &Android smartphone and works just fine on all of them. It gives you the right amount of pure beat that makes you enjoy what you are listing to but unfortunately there is no volume rocker. I tried it to answer a phone call and it is working as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Saif Al-Khuraisat

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I use this speaker almost daily. I can now hear my music/podcasts in the shower. I'm really pleased with the quality. I was upgrading from a non-bluetooth philips speaker. This model gives me lots of options for use and I can choose to have it corded or not. The removable cord makes it less likely that it will break (like the last one did). Now I just have to remember to pack it when I leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fordham

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Speaker for The Price
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound for the price. It gets pretty loud and can easily fill up a room, which is surprising for something you can hold in your palm. The bass is good, but not great and it will get distorted at the highest volumes. All-in-all you get more than what you expected for the price. The only downside is that there's no built in way to pair or daisy chain multiple speakers together (that I'm aware of). I'm not sure it why it makes mention of being able to in the product description unless they consider connecting them to a splitter as pairing.
customer_reviews.author: ramon

customer_reviews.title: it sound amazing for a little speaker but my device could not ...
customer_reviews.text: it sound amazing for a little speaker but my device could not hold a charge out of the box. I left it plugged in overnight and the light blinks so I know it's charging but as soon as I unplug it the device dies. It cannot hold a charge. It works well while plugged in. I am sending mine back and buying something a tad bit more expensive. I don't want to spend a lot and BT device since the sound quality on any BT device is crap. I don't how expensive the device is, the BT conversion is just no good. So maybe 50.00 will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: gianny figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my melon!
customer_reviews.text: I alternately refer to this speaker as my baby watermelon or my green sound grenade. Either way, I'm very happy with it. Clearly if you're looking to fill up your large room with booming sound, you're looking at the wrong item -- but if you want a fun, convenient way to listen to some tunes, this is a great buy. I sometimes carry it with me between home and office, just for a little music during the day. The battery life per charge is good, and the Bluetooth provides surprisingly clear sound. The weird green form factor? Just icing on the cake, and gives me a chuckle.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin K. Doi

customer_reviews.title: Philips SoundShooter Wireless Bluetooth Portable Speaker - Zoundz galore! Fun stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Philips SoundShooter Wireless Bluetooth Portable Speaker! > We bought 4 of these! Awesome! Sounds Great! Easy to Carry - Easy to Use! Great Value for your money! > Discontinued...SO WHAT! > Still GREAT and FUN! Low price! Very nice sound quality and volume! (Discontinued by Manufacturer) > but like I said, Lots of Fun to use! Also > VERY EASY TO CARRY with the provided CLIP!
customer_reviews.author: DishwasherSafe

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this one is nowhere near as good as the bluetooth version
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this one is nowhere near as good as the bluetooth version. I own both, and I am not sure why the sound on this one is not as good as the bluetooth version. The speaker top is different material than the wireless one and the aux cord is super short and flimsy. Not sure why they didnt just make the bluetooth version with an aux input.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney D

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: I have many different Bluetooth, and 3.5mm jack portable speaker systems, but this one by far is my favorite. Its compact size, and ability to charge with a standard micro USB cable make it ideal for the every day carry. At Max volume it can distort a bit, but one click down and it sounds perfect. I use this when I am working out in the yard, or sitting around the camp fire. It travels everywhere I go, and I am always being asked about it, as people cannot believe the sound quality coming from such a small package.
customer_reviews.author: RWKeenan

customer_reviews.title: If Your Expectiations are Reasonable at this Price Point, It's a Good Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a mono unit, with the speaker on top of the grenade-like body. It's very good for voice podcasts, and simple melodies. You don't want to play Beethoven or Black Sabbath on it, though. So, it's a light, sturdy, rechargeable unit that is a good value @ $25. (Actually, my opinion of it tracks closely with the CNET video review that's available online). One other caveat: I would NOT, under any circumstances, take this unit on an airplane. It looks too much like a grenade, IHMO. It is my opinion that official reality (the TSA) might well confiscate the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dion Dennis

customer_reviews.title: wow!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT speaker... charges easily with a standard phone charger... great huge sound in something that was almost laughably small when i took it out of the box. it really can easily fit in small person's (adult's) close palm. the sound is outstanding for what it is... and yet there is some distortion at the highest volumes with low tones. the bluetooth works around the house... so while one of us is in the shower listening to the ipad through this speaker... the actual ipad is in another part of the house doing some other work. rather miraculous technology.
customer_reviews.author: peter sherman

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time JBL Micro wireless is way better
customer_reviews.text: I own several Bluetooth speakers and am always looking for better ones. I love my JBL micro wireless and was going to buy another when i read about this speaker. Cnet even said this was better. There is no comparison. The JBL is much better with real bass and better sound. This speaker hardly produced any bass. Also the black speaker is khaki in color. The shape of the JBL fits better in your pocket. The speaker if this one is also exposed so it could get damaged much more easily.
customer_reviews.author: baf10

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Iphone 5 and I pad2
customer_reviews.text: Very nice color, easy to transport, You'll need to make any volume adjustments on your device as this has no volume adjustments itself. Outside is made of some kind of rubber so if it knocks around inside of a carrier with your device it won't likely scratch it. Gets loud enough to be heard well even outside. About 3" tall and 2" diamenter. Charger cord kinda short (about 16"). I've had mine about 2 months and use it every day, so far so good. Hard to tell how long it will run on a charge as I recharge mine daily (maybe 3 hours?). Hope this helps you make your decision-
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Queen

customer_reviews.title: Super light but BIG sound!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use while I run a Half Marathon that I can't use earphones in. It worked great! Even though there were many people around me at all times, the sound was great! Not too loud to annoy someone using their own headphones, but loud enough to hear and enjoy the music. I also use it when I ride my bike and the sound is perfect for that. So lightweight, you forget you're wearing or have it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pettygrue

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Still have it. Works great. Had it a few years and still holding up from beach and use it even in the shower : great speaker . Decent sound for the money
customer_reviews.author: Erin T.

customer_reviews.title: Love this small speaker
customer_reviews.text: Love this small speaker. It's been my third day playing with this speaker. speaker came with the full charged battery trying to waste the battery but it's taking longer than I thought So battery otherwise I give thumbs up. The sound is pretty good I was very surprised to see what the speaker can do it's pretty loud well not building stereo Volume control really doesn't affect much I think. Bluetooth it's okay though if there is a wall between you my have trouble connecting Bluetooth's to the device is self but in Openfield works great. And connecting Bluetooth to your device is really easy. Incoming call receiver works good you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Leesagkim

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a speaker for the golf course that he could use with his phone. he was skeptical when I bought this one, but after using it on the golf course, LOVES it! It is covered in rubber, so if he drops it or something, it is relatively protected. It fits in the cupholder, and has a great sound. (Not sound like you would hear from a nice set of Bose speakers, but good enough for the golf course.) Keep in mind, there is no volume control on the speaker itself. This can be an advantage so you don't have to adjust the volume in two places to get the level you want.
customer_reviews.author: RAisney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for it's size!
customer_reviews.text: The sound is quite surprising for it's size and I love the way it looks. I haven't tested the battery more than an hour or so but seems to charge quickly. The quality feels much better than others that I've tested at this size and the sound is much better. It would've been awesome feature if it had an "audio out" jack to hook up to headphones or to another stereo to connect Bluetooth to existing systems.....but I'm not too sure that it would be possible at this price point to get that feature. Would buy again, and highly recommend. Great job Philips! Please someone make the audio out available on the micro system and I'll be your biggest fan!
customer_reviews.author: Big Lag

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shipped this out quick and I must say after reading reviews I am impressed with quality of sound I bought it for being out on Golf course and leave it in cup holder fits perfect it held a charge thru 36 holes my friends are ordering one now. we put a paper cup on top of speaker cut out bottom like a cone and it enhanced the sound even more. best sounding speaker I have heard wireless for the size! you wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter4yu

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a few months only
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this initially, I absolutely loved it! However, since making my first purchase, I have had to throw away 3 of these already, because the first one quit working, the second quit working unless it was plugged in during use, and the third one started making horrible squeaking noises when in use, whether plugged in or not.
customer_reviews.author: R Wentworth

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good, but I wish it would produce a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no working radio in my car at this time, so it is an ok substitute to use with my phone to play music. Quality is good, but I wish it would produce a little more volume, but is limited to the volume on my phone. It sits in the hot sun in my car all day and still works fine. Long playing time between charges.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stegall

customer_reviews.title: Epic sounding football
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for almost a year, and absolutely love it. I owned a Bose Soundlink Mini for a short time, because of the great reviews and unfortunately it did not live up to expectation. This is a fraction of the price, and is almost as good as that. My car went out for a month, and had no problem because I had this. I take it to the beach, on photo shoots. It is durable, and has surprisingly fantastic sound. We call it the football, and love the design. It really thumps, especially indoors. Whenever we travel, we always bring the football. Friends have commented on how great it is for being so small.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mergenthaler

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time the battery life is great. It feels really well built. The outer skin makes it quite durable. My only complaints about this speaker is the fact that it doesn't have volume buttons on the speaker. You have to change the volume on your phone. The other issue for me is even the main connect button doesn't work to talk to siri, I use siri a lot if I'm using anything hands free. usually because my hands are covered in stuff. I don't want to use my hands on my phone while using hands free.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the few bucks extra
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is amazing. It's well worth the few dollars extra for the battery life and carabiner. It's illegal where I live to have headphones on while riding so having this thing attached to my bag while I ride is fantastic. Also it just bounces if ever dropped. The battery has lasted me well over 6 hours without any charging and it gets pretty darn loud. The bass is oviously almost non-existent but that's to be expected with any tiny speaker like this. Great for the boat as well!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: finding this
customer_reviews.text: I love this Phillips speaker and they are getting hard to find. I would carry this on my belt loop so I can music with me and they hold up so well to abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Bente

customer_reviews.title: Best blue tooth speak I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought this speaker 3 years ago now and it's still kicking. Used it in everywhere from surgery rooms to construction site. Sound is great and holds a charge for a extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Sweetland

customer_reviews.title: Like the feel
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and I like the feel of it it's nice and rubberized. So I feel like if I drop it it's protected and I like the fact that it has the hanging thing. I use it in my bathroom for phone calls and music when in the shower. It is really loud surprisingly and a good affordable price. I bought the green one so it was cheaper than the other colors. I notice that you can peel of the rubber so maybe they will come out with different covers or something for it. That would be a nice idea.
customer_reviews.author: meaghan

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound up to 3/4 volume. At full blast they rasp. Dropped from 5 feet and it stopped working. If you don't drop it, it should work fine for a personal speaker. Update: it works wired and if i hold the switch halfway between AUX and Bluetooth, the bluetooth does connect. So it seems the switch got shifted when dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Mountainman Mike

customer_reviews.title: Small, affordable and cute, but delivers satisfactory sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great for a little indoor sound. I wasn't looking to put on a outdoor concert, or fine one speaker to fill an arena: I wanted some tunes at work. This fills a 10x40 area with music that sounds good. I don't crank it way up, we have to be able to hear over it. But it sounds good and EVERYONE comments on how small it is. After hearing it all day they expect a much bigger speaker. It's also kinda cute to look at. If you are not mostly ridiculous, (don't expect Bose surround sound for $30), you will be very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly executed
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is amazing for its size. I can't imagine paying $200+ for some of the other Bluetooth speakers as this is loud enough for my whole front room even over a vacuum. The microphone is useful for phone calls although I wish the speaker could be just a touch louder when on phone calls (I'm guessing it's a feedback issue so they limited the volume). I have a JamXT speaker also and the range on this is ten times better and it never cuts out when I'm walking around with my phone on my belt.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good looking but extremely fragile. Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: Was pleased with the sound and the battery life. Worked great for about 6 months but then it fell from my nightstand (about 2 feet in height) to the cushiony carpeted floor and that was the end of it. Lights turn on and it still pairs up with my devices, but no more sound out of this thing. For a product that it's supposed to be rugged enough to take with you camping or hiking, and considering its price tag, this speaker falls very short.
customer_reviews.author: Revo Emag

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth speaker has very good sound for something that only cost me $28.00. I love how it comes with a clasp to connect it to a backpack or other item. The sound quality is not quiet as good as my Monster Bluetooth speaker, but that is expected considering my monster has two speakers and it cost more than this one. I am extremely satisfied with this speaker and I recommend it to others looking for quality portable sound in a small and convenient design.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to add volume to your mobile, iOS, or Android device, this speaker is solid. Easy to connect from device to device, but only allows one device to be connected at a time. This device does lack control features connected directly to the speak, must be controlled from device. Not a major flaw and 9/10 times, you'll be controlling it from your device anyway, however for those moments that your device is in the other it would be nice to have the ability to increase the volume and change the song. Sound quality is cool and love the color!
customer_reviews.author: William Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Decent portable speaker - but won't blow you away.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality isn't great. It makes a nice portable speaker for the pool area, or deck -- if you don't need to blast it. When volume is turned up, it gets a little staticy. Also, the base is pretty weak. Also the Bluetooth range isn't great, and often gets interrupted when you walk through the open space to phone/player. I use my Bose Soundlink around the house (absolute BEST sound quality and holds a charge for portability - great volume too) and use this grenade around the pool. Still looks freakin cool, though. Everyone comments on the form factor and color.
customer_reviews.author: McLok

customer_reviews.title: A really well designed product
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a ' we are sorry for the inconvenience caused' gift from amazon. I have been very happy with this product, it is ideal for small spaces like camping tents or bathrooms or social gatherings. Be aware thought that it has MONO and NOT STEREO output and the bass is a bit tinny but for the size and convenience its hard to beat. And it looks like a grenade :P
customer_reviews.author: Gopal C.

customer_reviews.title: great speaker but one big design flaw
customer_reviews.text: i bought the speaker w a wire connection (instead of bluetooth). the speaker is great. it has made music etc sound louder. but the big design flaw has to do with the wire connection, which is a thin flat wire that you pull and retract as you need. if that wire snapped or tore or got cut (it seems very delicate/fragile) then the speaker would be shot. not the best design i'd say. so far it's ok but i'm not sure how durable this wire will be. let's see...
customer_reviews.author: va-amzn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound and Design
customer_reviews.text: This cool looking hand grenade in army green sounds amazing for its size. I have it hanging from my rear view mirror since my radio needs replacing. Play Internet radio or my music on my smartphone and listen on my Phillips through Bluetooth. It connects right away and the coolest feature is I can hands free take calls through the speaker / microphone. The music automatically fades out to take the call. It sounds surprisingly good for the size and price. It is real quality materials. The so inexpensive and cool that all my guys are getting them for Christmas since all guys love gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Take Me To Grooveland

customer_reviews.title: Nice Speaker - Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Love this little speaker. Sound quality is good for size and much better than the speaker on my phone. The only this I wish it had was volume control on the actual unit and not just through my telephone. I can see this getting a lot of use this summer either using my phone or iPod on the beach since it's small enough to tuck away to prevent theft. Not sure anyone would even know what it was if it were left out of a bag! Unit is decently weighted which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: KelBake

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and is affordable
customer_reviews.text: Have an iPad Air 2 and an iPhone 5s. For the most part it works VERY well with the iPhone, but does not always connect with the iPad. Does drop signal once in awhile with iPhone too, but for the money the sound quality is excellent!!!! If I expected perfection, I would spring for the BOSE. This little speaker is portable and does what it promises. Works for me and my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki of CA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome new pal
customer_reviews.text: I love this neat little speaker! What do I love about it? well, lets see -It has a funky design (which also means its easier to find when lost. i have the green one) -brilliant sound (not that i haven't had better sound, but for its price, it has great sound) -retractable cord! no more millions of tangled up wires! (except for when you need to charge it- it comes w/ a usb plug) -it already comes charged and ready to use! (That, my friends, is pretty fantastic). It's overall a great buy, for a great price. We'll see if it lasts though. I'll keep ya posted!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Great, but Android Issues
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely have given this speaker at least 4 stars, but my friend had issues with it because of her Moto X (their latest system update prevented the control of the speaker volume, so the speaker is just auto-set to...well loud). While I know this isn't completely Philips fault, it does show the importance of having physical volume buttons on your bluetooth speaker, which this does not. Hopefully Motorola will fix their issue in their next update (like many other manufacturers have), or maybe Philips can give better instructions on how to fix this on their support site (they only tell you to update your phone and then it should work).
customer_reviews.author: Craig Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how this speaker sounds. Don't let its strange shape fool you. To me it sounds better than my jawbone jambox. That is pretty amazing given that this is only one speaker. The thing I like about it is the volume can be higher as well. The sides are rubber which is good if it falls, however the speaker is almost fully exposed on top.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Durden

customer_reviews.title: You won't be returning this little gem
customer_reviews.text: I tried the JBL one and others and this thing is as good as every positive review out there. I use it for backpacking in the backcountry and find the unique position of the speaker facing upwards towards your face is a big benefit. Battery life is amazing and the sound is rich enough through the mid-range. Don't regret this purchase one bit. Makes a great gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Chan

customer_reviews.title: Quick to deploy, decent sound
customer_reviews.text: No bluetooth here, just a quick retractable cord. So quick, you can plug it into your phone while taking a call. No fiddling with pairing. I like the sound. It is very good for voice calls or vocal music. It has just enough bass to make the music sound decent. Cheap ($17.99) when I purchased it. The price seems to vary by color. If you're not picky, you can get additional savings.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dunay

customer_reviews.title: What can you expect?
customer_reviews.text: For a small, inexpensive speaker, this is great. I have no CD/tape/MP3 player in my car, so I bought this so I could occasionally listen to my own music and liked the bluetooth feature. Speaker: Output is surprisingly good. Don't expect much in the way of low-tones. Bluetooth (use in car): Output is clear and uninterrupted. Caller complained I was cutting in/out quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: TKMom

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Portable Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Philips Wireless Bluetooth Speaker is very sturdy and durable. The sound is great but not excellent opposed to another portable speaker of it's size and price range. That being said I expected more sound from a grenade. Easy portability with the attached hook. There's no volume control on the device itself which isn't that much a big issue, but sometimes with it did have one for those times where I would leave the iPhone somewhere and only have the Bluetooth speaker with me, there is no way to adjust the sound. It's pretty easy to set up, almost plug and play, but some times you may have to fiddle around with it just a bit to get it connected.
customer_reviews.author: Psycoza

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: USB/Aux-in cable $9.94 It is not USB/Aux-in cable $9.94 Not *USB* as advertised! If you don't need USB, its fine little speaker to plug into a device. But no USB! Not *USB* as advertised! If you want one with a cable, then this is fine for price little speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Russell

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for Blutooth Speaker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device! I use it all the time when listening to music or Internet radio on my iPhone or iPad. The "D ring" is very handy for hanging the device from a hook or almost anything to get it at ear level or out of the grass. I've bought 2 of these and I'm sad to see they don't make them anymore but you can still find them. Also it has a built in microphone so you can use it as a speaker phone!
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Solid sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for kitchen or travel use. The recharge battery inside lasts about 6 hours of continuous play. Sounds great for a 40 dollar item. Be careful transporting it though, the top speaker area is exposed and could puncture. You'll want to buy a carrying case for it. I wouldn't clip it to your bay or a keychain, again the speaker would puncture.
customer_reviews.author: Abelardo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Comparing it to kinivo ZX100
customer_reviews.text: I compared it to Kinivo ZX100. As they sit now on my table. Low frequency threshold is 60 Hz for Philips VS 30 Hz for Kinivo (makes all the difference) High frequencies are ab0ut the same - 16-17 kHz Philips is a notch louder. Build quality are both very nice but Philips does NOT have volume control, 3.5 mm out and "bass texture". Kinivo doesn't have Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: vitya

customer_reviews.title: As a drummer
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I 'discovered' this speaker. I bought a HDMX jam and I was not happy when I compared it to my old Altec Lansing computer speakers. Could not hear the bass and did not feel the bass drum. And sound was not clear. So, I looked around Best Buy, Costco, and Amazon - looking for small budget speakers. Compared to HDMX jam, this is definitely better. Clearer sound and as a drummer, I love to hear the sweet sound of the ride cymbal and the punch of the bass drum. But of course, the bigger Altec Lansing computer speakers, though not as clear, gives a bigger sound.
customer_reviews.author: nonoyg

customer_reviews.title: great lil speaker
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small speaker to take with me on trips or just being outside...headphones sometimes just hurt to wear for long periods. this is a very good speaker with good bass...and good mid-range sound...it doesnt have its own volume control...i have a droid DNA and the speaker bluetooth connected no problems...I use the small clip to fasten onto belt loop when outside...all in all you will be satisfied
customer_reviews.author: rtd

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it..
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, easy to use.. The only thing I didn't like about this item, don't drop it in a travel unprotected.. The top of the speaker is delicate and can be torn, or a hole be punched punched in it.. I was lucky enough to have a camera case to drop it in for travel. That was the only down side.. The speakers rechargeable battery seems to hold true to specs. I have used it on a regular basis, and I am very happy with. I have recommended it to one of my friends for her daughter..
customer_reviews.author: M. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Great speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great price! Great speaker! I bought my Philips at a local discount store and took it on a family vacation. EVERYONE wanted to know where I got it.....unfortunately the discounter didn't have anymore. Thanks to Amazon....I still didn't pay full price, but gave these out as family birthday gifts this year!
customer_reviews.author: Jeana

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: the volume is pretty massive for its size. seems pretty durable. havent had any connectivity problems yet. I also found out from the manual that it has a built in microphone so you can take calls. thats pretty cool. the outside exterior is made out of a nice firm rubber like material. seems pretty durable to me(no plastic bs). it seems like the treble is stronger than the bass but thats not a problem. its what you expect from a small portable speaker (not that big of a deal at all) its the best speaker of its size in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sauce
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. Sound is fantastic, I put it on top of the fridge when I'm doing house work. VERY portable, took it with me on a trip once, clipped right on my carry on, and I always had music when I needed/wanted it. Holds a charge forever, and I have zero complaints. I would buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Best $25 Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I have this speaker on my desk at work and it is great. Remember it is only a $25 speaker and while the JBL Clip + is a much better speaker it does cost twice as much. I can play music softly in my office without bothering others. Connects easily and it really does last 8-10 hours between charges.
customer_reviews.author: mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker to use by the pool during our beach vacation. It was surprisingly loud and had good sound quality. The battery lasted the entire week without needing to be charged. The one issue I had was that it would randomly disconnect from the phone or iPad quite often. We tried several phones throughout the week and it didn't make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: good sound for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I like this little speaker, sounds good for just easy listening, not cranking it up loud. Price was good, cord retracts nicely inside. The only negative thing I suppose is the speaker is exposed, so I would not throw it into a backpack. It did not come with a protective cover or anything so I will have to make something or just use a crown royal bag or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: M. Deleon

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little gem!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing to use at work and anywhere, has really good sound and connected in seconds. I've always been a big fan of Philips and this SoundShooter is perfect for me. Love not having a volume setting on the unit itself, just use the devices volume to control it. Love the look and feel of it and also the input wire for connecting to non-Bluetooth devices. Very nice indeed.
customer_reviews.author: RoMZoMBiE

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the design very much, the speaker is unprotected and is susceptible to spills or other damage. But it sounds great, wouldn't have expected a single speaker to sound so good. It's also very portable and the carabiner makes it easy to hook onto a bag and carry around. Not disappointed with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Miles D

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a month ago primarily to listen to podcasts in a small bathroom while getting ready in the morning and it is adequate for the job. Pairs easily to iphone 5s and works well as a speakerphone. It is not a high-fidelity speaker by any stretch of the imagination, but at the $27 I paid for it on an Amazon "Today's Deals," a bargain. Have seen it for $47 at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Paperpeople

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't charge at all
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesn't charge, so this absolutely must be plugged in if I want to use it. I didn't use it until after the return period has passed, so by the time I figured it out I was stuck with this thing. on top of that, the sound quality is bad, and it doesn't get nearly as loud as you'd want it to, it's better to just play the music off your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Small Device, Big sound
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of reviews about this speaker. The one on cnet.com is what made me buy this speaker. Its true to the review. really great sound. The only con that I've come across is that the range is not what i'd expect and its especially poor when you are moving (i.e. clipped it to your belt and have your phone somewhere else. It performs better static and relatively close to your phone. But otherwise 100% satisfied with my purchase. I've looked at many in this price range and simply nothing else comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Speaker at great price
customer_reviews.text: This little speaker has great sound, is nicely compact and charges quickly. Be sure to check that the one you want is Bluetooth capable; some reviews indicated it was Bluetooth, but the item description was clear... I wasn't. I wanted one Bluetooth capable. But we're using this one on our phones and kindles...
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Decent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm reasonably happy with this speaker. I bought it to better hear podcasts, news and movies on my iPhone and iPad, and it works well for that. It's very compact and cute, and I like that I can clip it to a belt loop while moving around the house. The Bluetooth works great -- it connects right away. It also runs a really long time on one charge. The downside? It does not offer a big sound, and it's pretty expensive (I paid $30 for the green Bluetooth model) for what you get. I wouldn't buy it to listen to music or expect it to fill even a small room with sound.
customer_reviews.author: mmpdx

customer_reviews.title: Good speaker...
customer_reviews.text: Great design and construction. But for noisier environments, its just not loud enough. If you're looking for a speaker for a cubicle, or a relatively quiet environment, this is a solid choice, with nice balance for a smaller speaker, but if you've got a fair amount of ambient noise you're trying to push through, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: John Becknell

customer_reviews.title: Adequate sound, good price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first venture with a bluetooth speaker. I use it because it's convenient in my classroom to shoot out some music. With a room full of first graders busy at work, it makes for good low-level background music. For more sound, I'll get a set of computer speakers/subwoofer and plug them into my old firstgen Airport Express.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two
customer_reviews.text: I use the first all the time to listen to Audio books will I am working in the garage. I also clip it to a belt loop when I am out in the yard. The second went to my kids that listen to it in their garage garage/gym during their workouts. It out performs their big name/cost speaker that they use in the house. The first one came with a charger that has since bit the dust. Now I use the standard cables and chargers the I use for my other electronic toys. Maybe that explains why the second one just came with charging cables!
customer_reviews.author: Ray A.

customer_reviews.title: Battery wont hold charge
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instruction manual exactly, and this unit will not hold a charge. I made the mistake of not opening it immediately, having waited about a month and a half before taking it out and trying to use it, so I missed my deadline to return it. I'm happy with the sound quality, but it can't play if its not plugged in. I already have a sound bar for a stationary stereo, so the fact that I can't take it off the wall charger or computer is highly frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... fairly loud although the sound quality is not the best. My speaker did not charge so the only ...
customer_reviews.text: For its size it plays fairly loud although the sound quality is not the best. My speaker did not charge so the only way to play anything thru it was to keep it connected... Needless to say I returned it. If it was working properly I would keep it. It is nothing fancy but for the money a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Patol

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! especially if you have children... protective rubber casing if they drop it.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good for such a small speaker. The bass is "okay". treble/mid - "great" The unit is much small than expected which was a nice surprise = taller but skinner than a baseball. Great uses = beach/pool/grilling/outside work The only 2 cons: 1.You have to turn it down by the device your using tablet/Cell phone 2.it doesn't have internal storage compartment for the charging cable/AUX - so you have to keep up with it or put it somewhere you know where it is.
customer_reviews.author: R.O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome battery life. I charged it initially and have used it about 9 times over the past 2 months for 25-60 minutes at a time and it hasn't needed another charge!!! Decent sound for a little speaker. The bluetooth was super easy to set up with both my MacBook and iPhone. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NM boardie006

customer_reviews.title: Battery! Affordability! And Sound!
customer_reviews.text: First you need to understand this is NOT a bluetooth speaker. At first I thought it was and then later noticed the price difference on some of the other sound shooters. The sound is great, and loud, in certain situations, it doesn't project well outside, and when you have the volume maxed out on your devise (because there is no volume on the Shooter) it gets crackly and distorted. But for the price, I was more that pleased. The battery far outlasted my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Carney

customer_reviews.title: CNET recommend this! Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend $200 on a Bluetooth speaker so after much research, I chose this little guy. CNET said I'd get my best bang for my buck and I did. Enough base so the sound is pretty full. Easy to pair the Blu tooth.
customer_reviews.author: KittieKellie

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker for the price
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come in to expect a bose system paying only 25$ but it is a great little speaker smaller then a soda can the sound if great for something so small battery is great lasted me almost all day on one charge using Blue tooth also. would recommend loved the 25$ price tag i might be hesitant paying the regular 50$
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: amazing, impressive ,awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at the power this little thing has. It sounded great, bass was good, and it's really loud with minimal rattling. I thought I ordered a black one but it came in army murky green. No biggie though, the colour is nice too. It's definitely very portable. Perfect for beach use. Design is sleek n stylish. Simple one button, zero complexity.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: When reading comments i thought this device was bluetooth ready ...
customer_reviews.text: When reading comments i thought this device was bluetooth ready,the video was open online and said it was,i brought many items off this site and i am not satified with this item,in comments they give this type of stuff away,how much more to reimburse a unsatisfied customer,i will up my rating on this device if i am atleast notified,this item is not blue tooth ready,it should be displayed which devise it is.
customer_reviews.author: kevin adams

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly good.
customer_reviews.text: Saying honestly I was a big alarmed at the small size when the speaker arrived from Amazon. I had some similar size speakers where you put your phone in kind like a case with speakers and those were terrible. Very low sound level and quality. This one however appeared to be quite loud with low distortions and good frequency range.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a couple different portable speakers and this one is by far the best. I usually have to crank up the volume on my phone when I plug it in to the other speakers but I actually had to turn it way down for this one. Good sound for the size and like the fact that the cable is retractable and thin. Very easy to use and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Five star value
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. Convenient size. Durable. The downside to this is that the sound is STUNNING for its price point - do not expect Bose quality out of this, but is a great way to boost volume. I use this with my iPad and my iPhone especially when cooking as sizzling meat tends to drown out the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Leszkowicz

customer_reviews.title: that it is PERFECT. It has everything a portable wireless speaker needs ...
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have much time to read this review, I just want to let you know one thing about this product, that it is PERFECT. It has everything a portable wireless speaker needs to have, it is small in size, the sound is loud and clear. There is no noise at the maximum volume. I can hear it from across my living room. It connects to the bluetooth of the transmitting device instantly. Too bad, the company stopped making it. It was a great product and I love it. This has been my most satisfactory purchase on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ucmheasnhd

customer_reviews.title: excellent speaker!
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how loud this tiny little speaker is. It pairs easily with all bluetooth device I own. Battery life is great. I hang it on my bicycle when I'm riding. That way I can be more aware of my surroundings. I've dropped this so many times, and its still going!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: NIIIICE
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is really cool. For some reason I thought it had a little more power meaning, I thought it may go a little bit louder with a tad bit more bass. But overall this thing is better than the speaker on my iPhone. If you are expecting a huge booming sound, you may have to add another 50 bucks to get what you need, otherwise this will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Neale

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday and I am very impressed with the sound quality for such a small speaker. I bought it to use with my Kindle Fire HDX when we go on vacation in June to Punta Cana. I tested it yesterday to listen to music that I have dowloaded for the trip and watched several vidoes. Again, sound quality was suprising no matter what type of music I played. It says that it lasts up to 8 hours on a charge and I ran it for almost 9 hours yesterday and it never ran down. Great Product for the money. Have tried a few others but they were either distorted at higher volume or sounded like a can.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker for a great price! I have taken this speaker with me camping, fishing, tailgaiting, and just to hang out in the garage. I absolutely love this product. It is very loud, has a great range for the bluetooth and everything is controlled through the phone.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: It is a good buy, handy, stylish, excellent sound @ 2 watt RMS and a lower price. Best of all it doesnt look like a sound box, hence makes it more appealing. Like it !
customer_reviews.author: Good Samaritan

customer_reviews.title: Great portable speaker but clip breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted something small to carry with me while I went biking. The attached clip was a real convenience. The speaker quality is great. The sound is clear and loud but the flimsy clip broke pretty quick and now, it is not quite what I expected. I guess now I'm on the hunt for a clip that will fit to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I actually tie this to my handle bars while cycling on my own to listen to music. I prefer this way over headphones since I can still hear all the traffic around me. This thing can be pretty loud, I can always hear it over traffic. Infact if I turn it up too much it will kinda drown out the traffic (which I don't do, just FYI).
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Friend had one, now I do too...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my friend had it, and I liked it. It puts out good sound in a nice area around the person wearing it, whether it's in your pack or hanging from a loop somewhere I could hear it while we were biking downtown even underneath the overpasses of two criss-crossing highways.
customer_reviews.author: G Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little guy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little guy. This is something I carry around with me essentially everywhere I go and comes in handy at a moments notice.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: A great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I got this speaker for my sister as a gift. She lives in a country with inconsistent power and internet, so a portable and rechargeable speaker was essential. She has told me, it stands up to pretty rough conditions and has been a real God send. The only down side is the volume. The speaker can only get so loud, but the sound quality is better than average. It is still much louder than her ipad mini by itself. The battery has preformed as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: LargeHairyMan

customer_reviews.title: Range is very small, does not charge
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 different speakers from this line, all all worked great. For some reason the range on this specific one seems to only be less than half of the boasted range of 33 feet. Speaker begins to crackle and cut out when the source is only across a small bedroom from it. Edit: this product also does not charge with provided cable. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: The speaker can be used in Auxillary form or by Blue tooth.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an older model speaker that could be plugged into an old IPod. The speaker was perfect as it could be plugged in to the IPod (Aux.) or be used by Blue tooth. My daughter was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Orangekate

customer_reviews.title: Weak Bluetooth Signal and Poor Sound When Turned Loud
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this unit to replace my iBastek speaker. This speaker has a very weak Bluetooth signal. If anyone steps in the direct signal between the speaker and the unit sending the bluetooth signal to the speaker, it cuts in and out. That is a real problem for me. Also, The volume is not that great and when turned loud it starts to crackle and sound very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Daniele

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the "Grenade"!  It definitely DELIVERS! Just don't expect it to go BOOM!
customer_reviews.text: It's not a powerhouse like the UE Boom! But for the $ and being so small... it's definitely worth it. The UE Boom is so big and heavy... you really have to be committed to taken it with you... but this thing? I take it everywhere (thanks to the Carabineer Clip) and now I'm actually enjoying listening to music on my iPhone other than in my car. You will love it! (as long as you don't have plans drop the bass)
customer_reviews.author: Swainer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little speaker
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little speaker. Can't beat it for the price. Lasts a long time with a full charge. Durable, and esy to use. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Sounds fine in a quiet room ...
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sounds fine under ideal conditions, but if you have a laundry machine going in the background, want to use this outside, or use it in the car, not so much. The real problem is the lack of volume control -- sound is adjusted from your player. And at higher volumes, the sound is pretty rough.
customer_reviews.author: Kane

customer_reviews.title: A good speaker
customer_reviews.text: Even though the sound is in mono mode, it's pretty crisp and volume adjusted from a cell phone was good . Bluetooth setup was very easy, calls and music always heard very clear. Size excellent, fits in the palm of the hand. Can't find any negatives yet for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Lubo

product_meta.title: Philips SoundShooter Wireless Bluetooth Portable Speaker SBT30ORG/27 (Orange) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:Orange| Style:BluetoothPowerful sound supported by wireless music streaming via Bluetooth, a rechargeable battery for playback anywhere and a built-in microphone for hands-free phone calls. And a carabineer too, to clip onto your belt or bag

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Supported by wireless music streaming via Bluetooth, the Philips SBT30 Bluetooth Sound Shooter offers powerful sound in a compact, stylish design and fits in the palm of your hand. This portable mono speaker supports music streaming from Bluetooth-enabled devices such as smartphones, tablets, and laptops, allowing you to enjoy your favorite music without the hassles of wired connections. It includes a carabiner to clip to your belt or bag, making it ideal for on-the-go lifestyles.

Powerful sound in a compact, stylish design that fits in the palm of your hand. View larger.

Just clip the speaker to your belt or bag to take your music with you. View larger.

BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY FOR WIRELESS STREAMING
Featuring Bluetooth technology, the Philips SBT30 Sound Shooter allows you to easily stream music from other Bluetooth devices up to 30 feet away. Simply connect your favorite Bluetooth-enabled device, such as a smartphone, tablet, or laptop, to enjoy your music with wireless convenience. 

The SBT30 also includes a 3.5-millimeter auxiliary input for wired connections to other music devices. 

PORTABLE DESIGN WITH RECHARGEABLE BATTERY
Small enough to fit in the palm of your hand, the Sound Shooter's compact, barrel-shaped design and light weight make it ideal for use around the home or while traveling. A handy carabiner lets you clip the speaker to your belt or bag for easy transport. The unit's built-in, rechargeable lithium battery lasts up to eight hours and can be charged via the included USB cable, letting you enjoy your music without the fuss of entangled power cords or the need for an electrical outlet. 

BUILT-IN MICROPHONE WORKS AS A SPEAKERPHONE
A built-in microphone lets you use the Sound Shooter as a hands-free speakerphone. When a call comes in, the music is put on pause and you can talk via the speaker. Use it for business meetings, parties, or just calling a friend. 

ABOUT PHILIPS
With a proud history in technology, including the invention of the compact audio tape cassette and the CD, Philips is committed to understanding and meeting the needs and desires of consumers. With over 50,000 registered patents, Philips is a global leader in innovation, receiving numerous international design and acoustics awards every year. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Philips SBT30 Bluetooth Sound Shooter, USB/3.5-millimeter dual cable, and quick start guide. 

BLUETOOTH SOUND SHOOTER
AT A GLANCE:
 * Bluetooth technology for wireless music streaming
 * Compatible with most Bluetooth-enabled smartphones, tablets, and laptops
 * Compact design includes carabiner for easy portability
 * Built-in battery rechargeable via USB connection
 * Built-in microphone works as a speakerphone

The speaker's carabiner makes it the ideal travel companion. View larger.

Built-in rechargeable battery

Up to 8 hours music playback.

Charge and play in one cable.
feature_bullets: Built-in rechargeable battery for music playback anywhere
Built-in microphone for hands-free phone calls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars692 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #7,214 in Portable Bluetooth Speakers#52,499 in MP3 & MP4 Player Accessories
